Row.Text: A pilgrim arrives! Well met, stranger. I am known as Amoghavarsha Nrupathanga, the emperor of the Rashtrakuta.
And so we are condemned to the annals of history. I urge you to at least remember us fondly.
I had hoped it wouldn't come to this. I suppose I'll have to destroy you quickly to restore peace.
It is rare to find my equal in wisdom, but I feel ready to grant you such a title. Would you be interested in a public Declaration of Friendship?

Mixing Kannada and Sanskrit may sound unpleasant, but I will still advise it to you, because it distracts from the worthlessness of your words.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I do not relish warfare, but sometimes it is the only way forward.
My own lands may stretch from the Godavari to the Kaveri, but not everyone can be so blessed. Do not attempt to exceed your station.
I hope you've come to try to wash the blood from your hands.
Ah, the return of a friend! I've prepared some poetry for the occasion.
I hope your stay has been pleasant. Have you seen the statuary?
This is a sacred place. I'd rather you didn't come inside.
You seem to have confused my domain for a military exercise field. I would encourage you to change your behavior, and not to delay in doing so.
An exchange of goods? I would be honored to see what your country has to offer.
The cost may have been steep, but it was worthwhile for peace.
I may be a man of faith, but I still appreciate worldly goods. Perhaps you'd be willing to share yours?
Don't bother. I may not start wars, but I finish them.
Pilgrimage is an important part of the noble life. If you'd allow it, I would be honored to visit your sites.
My patience can only stretch so far.
These times are not kind. If you could provide some aid, it would save me from needing to call the emergency tax on my people.
I am sorry to hear that you have such anger.
It is better to have one decisive war than many small ones.
You seem to have assumed that I avoid fighting because of inability. I hope I've disabused you of that notion.
